cont.entity_a: Very detailed upper frequencies and voices. Capable of very deep bass, but requires EQ adjustment for more bass. Sound is incredible for the cost, offering a super value. Sound quality is top-notch with no artificially boosted bass or treble. Industry standard headphones known for their neutral sound. Suitable for studio monitoring with a flat response across the audio spectrum.
cont.entity_b: Crisp and clean with decent lows, but weak bass for hip-hop. Balanced in the high and mid frequencies. Good but not comparable to higher-end brands like Bose.

cont.entity_a: Durable with replaceable ear pads and a long-lasting build quality.
cont.entity_b: Subpar with weak plastic parts prone to breaking. Plastic broke within a few months, leading to unusable headphones.

cont.entity_a: With a great adjustment system, fitting a broad range of head sizes. Not true over-ear headphones for larger ears, causing discomfort over time.
cont.entity_b: Sometimes forgettable when wearing. Hard clamp can become uncomfortable and cause headaches after prolonged use.

cont.entity_a: Fold-up mechanism improves portability, but not as portable as some other models. Coiled cable is long and can stretch surprisingly far.
cont.entity_b: Portable with a short cord, limiting movement. Good for portable use but not comparable to high-end models like Grado RS1 or AKG K701.

cont.entity_a: Cord is well made and sturdy, with a nice aluminized plug. Coiled cable is long and can stretch surprisingly far.
cont.entity_b: Portable with a short cord, limiting movement.

cont.entity_a: Arrived well packaged including a plug adapter and carrying bag. Some concerns about potential counterfeit products due to packaging differences.
Provides good isolation from outside noise.
